description_html: Keep it objective: no first or second person.
story_html:
Make it personal (first and second person ok), preferably with a beginning, middle, and end.

To keep up to date, follow this site on social media or join the SeeOurMinds.com email list!

image_list.title: E. B. Farnum
image_list.subtitle_html: Hotel Owner and the First Mayor of Deadwood
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: E. B. Farnum's spiritual portrait shows he is very perceptive and not very decisive.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Yellow in this spiritual portrait represents E. B. Farnum's dominant personality trait, his realism and openness to experiences.  In Extraverts, the dominant trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long vertical line to represent this, because it is the side of their personality that is most evident.  E. B. demonstrates this in the way he is constantly seeking new information - especially from rich and powerful people - hoping it will help him make easy money off the gold rush in Deadwood.
image_list.explain_aux: The Red in this spiritual portrait represents E. B. Farnum's auxiliary personality trait, his amiability and friendliness.  In Extraverts, the auxiliary trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a horizontal line to represent this.  Given E. B.'s perceptive and ambitious nature, his amiability frequently finds expression in flattery and other forms of 'sucking up.'

image_list.title: Doc Cochran
image_list.subtitle_html: Deadwood's Only Doctor
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Doc Cochran's spiritual portrait shows he is very logical and comfortable with abstractions.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Blue in this spiritual portrait represents Doc Cochran's dominant personality trait, his openness to ideas.  In Introverts, the dominant trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long horizontal line to represent this.  The Doctor demonstrates this trait in the curiosity he shows when dissecting corpses in an effort to better understand the human body and how he might heal people's illnesses.
image_list.explain_aux: The Green in this spiritual portrait represents Doc Cochran's auxiliary personality trait, his strong preference for logic over emotion.  In Introverts, the auxiliary trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a vertical line to represent this, because it is more evident than the dominant function.  The Doc demonstrates his ability to reason when he advises patients on how they should treat their ailments and, in some cases, change their self-destructive behaviors.

image_list.title: Whitney Ellsworth
image_list.subtitle_html: Prospector and Alma Garret's Husband
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Whitney Ellsworth's spiritual portrait shows he is down-to-earth and friendly.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Yellow in this spiritual portrait represents Whitney Ellsworth's dominant personality trait, his pragmatism and realistic outlook.  In Extraverts, the dominant trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long vertical line to represent this, because it is the side of their personality that is most evident.  Ellsworth demonstrates this trait when he 'looks the other way' after Dan Dority kills Alma Garret's husband.
image_list.explain_aux: The Red in this spiritual portrait represents Whitney Ellsworth's auxiliary personality trait, his amiability and compassion.  In Extraverts, the auxiliary trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a horizontal line to represent this.  Ellsworth demonstrates this trait in the way he is, in general, quite friendly to most of the people he encounters and, in particular, able to quickly befriend Alma Garret's traumatized adoptive daughter Sofia.

image_list.title: A. W. Merrick
image_list.subtitle_html: Owner of Deadwood's First Newspaper
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: A. W. Merrick's spiritual portrait shows he is decisive and open to new ideas.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Red in this spiritual portrait represents A. W. Merrick's dominant personality trait, his passion and warmth.  In Extraverts, the dominant trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long vertical line to represent this, because it is the side of their personality that is most evident.  Merrick demonstrates this trait in the way he is outgoing, amiable, and friendly to most everyone he meets.
image_list.explain_aux: The Blue in this spiritual portrait represents A. W. Merrick's auxiliary personality trait, his openness to new ideas.  In Extraverts, the auxiliary trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a horizontal line to represent this.  Merrick demonstrates this when he founds Deadwood's first newspaper, and in the way he is open to new technical innovations, such as photography and the telegraph.

image_list.title: Charlie Utter
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Charlie Utter's spiritual portrait shows he is ....  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Red in this spiritual portrait represents X's dominant personality trait, Feeling: passion; amiability; friendliness; compassion; warmth; very slight/moderate/strong preference for emotion/empathy/subjectivity over logic/reason/objectivity; their very slight/moderate/strong preference for the emotional/personal/subjective over the logical/rational/objective.

The Red in X's spiritual portrait represents their dominant personality trait, their very slight/moderate/strong preference for making emotional/personal/objective rather than logical/rational/objective decisions; their very slight/moderate/strong preference for making emotional/personal/subjective decisions.
image_list.explain_dom_constant: In Introverts, the dominant trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long horizontal line to represent this.  He/She demonstrates/exhibits this trait in their (note that is easier to find examples of decisions than perceptions!) ....
image_list.explain_aux: The Yellow in this spiritual portrait represents X's auxiliary personality trait, Sensing: pragmatism; realism; realistic; outlook; openness to experiences; very slight/moderate/strong preference for facts over ideas.
The Yellow in X's spiritual portrait represents their auxiliary personality trait, their very slight/moderate/strong preference for seeing the world more in terms of facts than of ideas.
image_list.explain_aux_constant: In Introverts, the auxiliary trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a vertical line to represent this, because it is more evident than the dominant function.  He/She demonstrates/exhibits this trait in their (note that is easier to find examples of decisions than perceptions!) ....
